div.l: That helpith hym · to wast and to sowke
Of that he brike can · or borwe may
Anon he sent his bedde · and his array
Vnto a compere · of his owne sort
That loved dise and Revel and disport
And had a wif · that hield for countenaunce
A shoppe and swyved · for hir sustenaunce
Of this Cookes tale · makith Chauucer nomore
¶ Here endith the Cookes tale
¶ The prophemye of the manne of lawes tale
Ovre hoost saw wele · that the high sonne
The Ark of the artificial day · had I ronne
The fourthe part · and half an houre more
And thogh he were nat expert in lore
He wist it was the · xviij day
Of Aprill that is messangier to May
And sawe wele that the shadwe · of eủery tree
Was as in length · the same quantite
That was direct the body · that caused it
And therfor bi the shadwe · he toke his wit
That Phebus that shone · so cler and bright
Degrees was xlv clomben on hight
And for that day as in that latitude
It was ten of the clokke · he gan conclude
And sodainly he taught his hors aboute
Lordynges quod he · I warne yow al this Route
The fourth party · of this day is gon
